creator: mgarski@post.pl
text: I attach a patch that correct two typos in polish error messages.

creator: mgarski@post.pl
text:
Created attachment 19045
Fix polish error messages

Created attachment 25383
Fix Polish error messages v2

I'm attaching an extended patch, since Polish HTTP error messages contain even more spelling errors: inflectional suffixes in acronyms are always separated with hyphen in Polish (see the relevant orthographic rule: http://so.pwn.pl/zasady.php?id=629584), so there should be "URL-a" and not "URLa".

BTW it's nearly 4 years since submitting this trivial bug, and it's still not fixed - it's high time!
creator: zrchos@gmail.com
poirier@pobox.com
text:
While we're at it, could the Polish error text use HTML character entity references like the other languages do, instead of embedding international characters directly?  Otherwise the files have a weird mix of character encodings, and some text editors refuse to deal with them.

If you can make that change, and no one objects, I'll commit the patch.

creator: zrchos@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 25386
Fix Polish error messages v3

OK, I replaced all non-ASCII characters in Polish messages with their corresponding decimal HTML character references.
Is patch against trunk?  It isn't applying.
creator: poirier@pobox.com
zrchos@gmail.com
text:
Oops, sorry, I made it against an older version...
I'm uploading a new patch, made against trunk version 940737.

Created attachment 25393
Fix Polish error messages v4
creator: zrchos@gmail.com

text:
Thanks for the corrections.  Fixed in trunk, r940824.

The changes will not backport cleanly to 2.2.x due to other changes that have been made in trunk.
creator: poirier@pobox.com
